DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent Disease, Distant Site Medical Examination Tissue Anatomic Site ICD-O-3 Topography Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease, at a site different and away from the original site.:An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms._An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:Named locations of or within the body._Codes representing the ICD-10 classification coding site (topography) of malignant neoplasms (except those categories which relate to secondary neoplasms and to specified morphological types of tumours) for all types of tumors.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Recurrent Disease, Distant Site Medical Examination Tissue Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease, at a site different and away from the original site.:An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms._An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Recurrent Disease, Distant Site Medical Examination
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease, at a site different and away from the original site.:An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

Concepts.definition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease, at a site different and away from the original site.
An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/28/10 Released for use in caTissue Suite version 1.1 and/or 1.2 per owners direction.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Codes representing the ICD-10 classification coding site (topography) of malignant neoplasms (except those categories which relate to secondary neoplasms and to specified morphological types of tumours) for all types of tumors.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, third edition (ICD-O-3).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
